security: This document confirms that Peter J. DICERVINO has no known security compromises that would prevent his assignment to Madrid, Spain. Revealing that a security clearance was run and approved exposes internal security procedures. Quoting directly: 'Security files contain no record of declaration or compromise to foreign Governments or intelligence/security services. There is no indication of security factors which would affect the proposed action.'
summary: A memo from the Deputy Director of Security to the Chief of the Central Cover Staff stating that security files contain no record of compromise for Peter J. DICERVINO's assignment to Madrid, Spain.
summary_one_paragraph: On June 15, 1967, a memorandum from Victor R. White, the Deputy Director of Security, was sent to the Chief of the Central Cover Staff, specifically addressed to Mr. Thomas K. Strange, concerning Peter J. DICERVINO's upcoming assignment to Madrid, Spain. In response to a previous inquiry on June 12, 1967, the memo indicates that security files show no record of any declarations or compromises to foreign governments or intelligence/security services, and there are no apparent security factors that would negatively impact the proposed assignment.
title: Peter J. DICERVINO
